that's seven penalties saved from the thirteen he has faced - a truly outstanding record.\n\nA superb free kick by Trent Alexander-Arnold set us on our way and James Milner finished the job with a clever chip that took a deflection before ending up in the net.\n\nIt was disappointing to concede a late goal but it showed again we desperately need to strengthen with new signings for the defence before the window closes at the end of August.\n\nWhat puzzled me was why Moreno was starting at Hoffenheim ahead of the more reliable James Milner?\n\nMoreno was the only real negative for me on the night, as once again he performed like a \"headless chicken\" - leaving gaps galore on Liverpool's left hand side and leaving the defence over-stretched.\n\nMoreno in my opinion has not got a football brain. He was continually caught out of position and was making attacking runs at the wrong times. He is simply, defensively a liability and I hope to see the return of Milner against Palace.\n\nLast January we saw the pictures of a beaming Philippe Coutinho after signing a new five-year deal worth a reputed \u00a3150,000 a week with the Reds, taking him up to the summer of 2022.\n\nHe was quoted as saying he was \"delighted\" to sign a new contract, \"he loves the fans, the club and the City of Liverpool\" and \"Jurgen Klopp is a winner\" and he was looking forward to the future with LFC.\n\nFast forward just eight months later to today, and we see a moody Coutinho, wanting to leave LFC after putting in a transfer request.\n\nThere are rumours coming from his camp that he does not see eye to eye with the manager and that LFC always make it difficult for players to leave.\n\nCoutinho states he has a \"back injury\" but how often in the past have we witnessed these prima donna footballers, who really do live in a different world than the man in the street, feign injury or state they are not in the \"right frame of mind\" to play, in order to gain the mega bucks move that they crave.\n\nNow I am not saying for definite here that Coutinho is feigning injury, but it does seem a strange coincidence that he has a \"bad back\" at this time when he and his agent are chasing a move to Barcelona.\n\nVideo Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8Cancel Play now\n\nA player all LFC fans thought loved the club and was a \"nice guy\" has shown his true colours and true character - and it ain't a pretty sight.\n\nIf the club go ahead and sell Coutinho against the wishes of Klopp it would surely break the trust between the boardroom & the manager and surely when that happens there is only one outcome.\n\nI expect Liverpool Football to adhere to the wishes of Jurgen Klopp and refuse point blank to bow to Barcelona, Coutinho and his agent's demands.\n\nWouldn't be it be nice, if for the first time a club of the stature of Liverpool FC says \"enough is enough\" and demand that the player fulfills his five year contract he willingly signed just a few months ago.\n\nModern football in 2017 - it stinks.\n\nGraham Agg, Netherton\n\nSelling Coutinho would lead to Reds recruiting two inferior replacements\n\nThe argument from some pundits to sell Phillippe Coutinho and invest in other areas of the side is nonsensical.\n\nThe Brazilian's skill-set of vision and weight of pass to dissect a low block defence is irreplaceable and instantly changes the side's realistic ambitions for the season.\n\nAdd to the fact Coutinho is two players in one, being a number eight and higher left sided forward means Liverpool would have to replace two positions with players of inferior quality.\n\nThe club have been willing to spend upwards of \u00a3140million on the two targets identified as elite level purchases with sellers refusing to do business.\n\nWhy would this change with two weeks of the window to go, alongside the issue of replacing Coutinho's world class talent.\n\nSimply put it wouldn't and Liverpool would be an inferior side.\n\nMark Baker, Huyton\n\nAim big - throw all the Coutinho money on Deli Alli\n\n'A bad back' seems to be the most appropriate phrase for the start of our season. Whether it's the reason for Phil Coutinho not being in the squad, or the reason we dropped points against Watford, we must find a solution to this debilitating problem.\n\nI am disappointed that we've begun without an upgraded defence.\n\nMoreno was clearly not in Klopp's plans last term, and yet here he is starting as our first choice left back. That can't be right?\n\nI don't think its simply a matter of personnel either. Even if we manage to get Virgil Van Dijk, our defensive coaching still needs vast improvement.\n\nThe Coutinho saga needs resolution. I hope LFC are currently getting all their transfer target ducks in a row, ready to spend the Barcelona money as soon as the deal is done.\n\nPie in the sky I know, but Spurs don't pay top wages. Their chairman is very financially astute. Deli Alli grew up a Livepool fan.\n\nSay we offered them all the Barca money for Alli, and offered him double his salary, would they both just say no? Remember, we had the money to buy Van Dijk AND Keita even before Barcelona came calling so it wouldn't eliminate our other plans.\n\nCome on Liverpool. AIM BIG!\n\nFinally, a shout out to young Trent Alexander-Arnold. A great start to the season, and a great contribution on Tuesday night. A huge future awaits.\n\nSimon Donnelly, Freshfield\n\nWe've underperformed in the transfer market in what could be the worst summer since Hodgson in 2010\n\nWhat a great win for the Reds against Hoffenheim following the frustration of throwing two precious points away against Watford on Saturday. We now have one foot in the Champions League and the victory was fully deserved.\n\nWell done to Trent Alexander-Arnold for his fantastic goal and impressive start to the season. In Alexander-Arnold we also have someone who can actually take a decent corner.\n\nAgainst Watford it was a hugely frustrating performance. We made Okaka look like Kaka in the first half and, although he impressed in pre-season, it is a sad state of affairs that Alberto Moreno is first choice left back.\n\nPersonally, I think that the goalkeeper must take the blame too for allowing people to head goals in from inside the six-yard box.\n\nDespite the frustrations, hopefully we will beat Palace at Anfield at the weekend to move up to four points - which would be one point better off than at the same stage last season when we lost to Burnley.\n\nTo not improve our defence adequately over the summer is not acceptable in my opinion. It has been well known that a new centre back was required but we have not strengthened enough.\n\nPersonally I think that this transfer window has been one of the most disappointing in recent years.\n\nMo Salah is an excellent signing but aside from that, to get into the Champions League yet still end up in this situation shows incompetence from those in charge.\n\nIan Ayre was always blamed in the past when we couldn't get deals over the line but those in charge now have really underperformed.\n\nThere was genuine excitement amongst the fans at the end of last season but since then not one of the manager's first choice targets - Keita, Van Dyke, Brandt, Oxlade-Chamberlain, Sessegnon - have been secured.\n\nOn top of that we risk losing Philippe Coutinho despite the club knowing that he was always likely to leave and that he has courted Barcelona over the past year.\n\nIt is not quite as bad the Roy Hodgson window of the summer of 2010 when we unveiled Paul Konchesky and Christian Poulsen - but it is not far off.\n\nMichael Atherton, Crosby", "dateTime": "2017-08-17T04:43:00Z", "extractedDates": null, "sim": 0.4901960790157318, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-17", You don't know whether a player is unhappy or a club are willing to sell until you ask the question.\"\n\nThe European Cup winning captain thinks Tottenham midfielder Alli would also add another attacking dimension to a Reds side without Coutinho.\n\n\"They could go after Dele Alli, who was a Liverpool supporter as a kid,\" Thompson added. \"Tottenham are a bit like Liverpool in that there's always a price on a player.\"\n\nAguero has plundered 170 goals in six years for Manchester City, and he would give Liverpool an attacking thrust up top, according to Thompson.\n\n\"Sergio Aguero is another player that might be interested if he's not happy at Manchester City,\" he added.\n\n\"But it comes back to being late in the window and that is the difficult situation Liverpool find {"id": "9732895", "categories": [{"id": 14, "label": "dmoz/Sports", "uri": "dmoz/Sports", "wgt": 100}, {"id": 33, "label": "dmoz/Sports/Soccer", "uri": "dmoz/Sports/Soccer", "wgt": 100}, {"id": 597, "label": "dmoz/Sports/Soccer/UEFA", "uri": "dmoz/Sports/Soccer/UEFA", "wgt": 100}, {"id": 673, "label": "dmoz/Sports/Soccer/AFC", "uri": "dmoz/Sports/Soccer/AFC", "wgt": 100}, {"id": 751, "label": "dmoz/Games/Board Games/Abstract", "uri": "dmoz/Games/Board_Games/Abstract", "wgt": 100}, {"id": 822, "label": "dmoz/Sports/Football/Australian Rules", "uri": "dmoz/Sports/Football/Australian_Rules", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-17", "uri": "710993921", "source": {"id": "709", "title": "Sky Sports", "uri": "skysports.com"}, "url": "http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/10992677/liverpool-can-keep-philippe-coutinho-but-should-aim-to-replace-him-says-phil-thompson", "body": "Phil Thompson\n\nFootball Expert @Phil_Thompson4\n\nLiverpool can keep Philippe Coutinho but should aim to replace him, says Phil Thompson\n\nLast Updated: 17/08/17 5:09pm\n\nPhil Thompson believes Liverpool will keep Philippe Coutinho this summer but would prefer to see him replaced with another top class player.\n\nThe Anfield legend believes that the claims from Barcelona general manager Josep Segura that a deal is close will only serve to to cement the Reds' resilience, especially given the difficulties of securing an adequate replacement two weeks before the close of the transfer window.\n\nHowever, Thommo would rather see the club pursue all alternative avenues rather than potentially being left with an unhappy player.\n\nHe told Sky Sports: \"The ideal resolution is that the club will leave it very late and get as much as they can for him. If he doesn't want to stay then I'd rather see him sold for the best price, but the big issue is that there won't be any players near is quality on the market.\n\n\"It's probably too late in the window to get somebody in, so I think they'll keep him for a season. Coutinho might argue that Barcelona won't be there again but if you believe you're a top player then a top club will always be interested.\n\nThommo predicts...\n\nFind out what Thommo is predicting for Liverpool v Crystal Palace here.\n\n\"I think the owners will hold firm. They've backed themselves into a corner with the statements they've made along with Jurgen Klopp's comments, so I just don't see how they can go back on that, especially when the fans are already quite unhappy with the summer transfer business as deals for Virgil van Dijk and Naby Keita are looking increasingly unlikely.\n\n\"The comments coming out from Barca saying that a deal is close might be a red flag to a bull, making the owners, who are adamant because of the deal they gave him six months ago, even more focused on standing their ground, so I think they will keep him.\"\n\nThommo is hopeful that the club can identify targets, urging them to use the same aggressive tactics which prompted Coutinho to hand in a transfer request on the eve of the season.\n\nHe added: \"What they can do is try to find somebody out there, maybe even play Barcelona at their own game and say you can have Coutinho but we want Luis Suarez.\n\n\"Suarez might be unhappy with the Neymar situation. You don't know whether a player is unhappy or a club are willing to sell until you ask the question.\n\n\"They could go after Dele Alli, who was a Liverpool supporter as a kid. Tottenham are a bit like Liverpool in that there's always a price on a player.\n\n\"Sergio Aguero is another player that might be interested if he's not happy at Manchester City, but it comes back to being late in the window and that is the difficult situation Liverpool find themselves in.\n\n\"Signing Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain would be a start and would be available for the right money with his contract situation at Arsenal, but the club need to be ready to move if they do sell so we're not caught short.\"\n\nThommo is concerned that the absence of Adam Lallana, who has been ruled for a number of months with a thigh injury, would make the sale of Coutinho and failure to replace him even more concerning.\n\n\"Lallana isn't going to be back in the team for a few months,\" the Soccer Saturday pundit said. \"He's another one of you more creative players behind the forwards, so you're looking at a less creative Liverpool team without either of them.\"\n\nSuper 6 \u00a31million\n\nWill you be Super 6's first millionaire? Will Philippe Coutinho get his wish for a move to Barcelona or will Liverpool hold him at Anfield?\n\nHe's got a five-year contract at his current club so they are under no obligation to sell, but with rumours that Barcelona are set to come in with a third bid and Coutinho sitting out of Liverpool's opening games of the campaign, he could still be off. How do you replace someone like Coutinho?\n\nThe 26 year-old is one of Europe's hottest prospects this summer and has even been the subject of a reported \u00a354 million bid from Barcelona. He netted 18 Serie A goals last season for the club he has played for since coming through their Youth Academy. He was once called the 'Italian Messi' by former Napoli team-mate Goran Pandev and can be utilised anywhere across the front line. He can also hit a free-kick although after Tuesday evening's strike, he would have to battle Trent Alexander-Arnold for that privilege at Anfield. Reports by TransferMarketWeb suggest he could be moving to Liverpool regardless of Coutinho's future. Seri is an Ivory Coast international who is also reportedly interesting Arsenal, Barcelona and PSG. The 26 year-old midfielder netted seven Ligue 1 goals last season. Stamina and a good passing ability mean he is the man who makes Nice tick in the middle of the park and therefore could also be seen as an alternative signing to Naby Keita for the Reds.\n\nAnother player with just a year to run on his current deal, the Ox could be on his way out of the Emirates. Reports in the Express claim both Liverpool and Manchester United have enquired about his availability with Chelsea also interested. The winger can also play centrally and that versatility would certainly appeal to Jurgen Klopp and his fluid formation. The England international netted just two Premier League goals last season.\n\nPerhaps less likely to move to Liverpool, the Real Madrid star has nonetheless been linked with a move to Anfield this summer. Asensio scored during the first leg of the Spanish Super Cup against Barcelona but is reportedly attracting interest from Arsenal, Manchester City, Juventus and Bayern Munich. {"id": "10031959", "categories": [{"id": 256, "label": "dmoz/Sports/Soccer/Competitions", "uri": "dmoz/Sports/Soccer/Competitions", "wgt": 100}], "date": "2017-08-19", "uri": "711826750", "source": {"id": "6822", "title": "Football Gossip", "uri": "footballgossip.org.uk"}, "url": "http://www.footballgossip.org.uk/index.php/2017/08/19/liverpool-guaranteed-80m-latest-coutinho-bid/", "body": "Liverpool were only guaranteed \u00a380million in the latest bid from Barcelona for Brazilian midfielder Philippe Coutinho.\n\nThe Reds rejected Barca's third bid for Coutinho which was said to be for a total of \u20ac130million. The bid was said initially to have been made up of a guaranteed \u20ac120million (\u00a3110million) with a further \u20ac10million (\u00a39million) in add-ons and bonuses.\n\nHowever, the Daily Mirror claims to have seen details. It claims that only \u00a380million was guaranteed to Liverpool. The paper adds that many of the add-ons would have been difficult to attain. These included winning multiple trophies in the same season, winning multiple Champions League titles, winning the Ballon d'Or and even winning multiple trophies and the Ballon D'Or in the same season. In addition, Barcelona would only have paid the \u00a380million over a five-year period.\n\nIf those claims are true then it would mean that Barcelona have offered only slightly more up front in this bid than they did in their previous of bid totalling \u20ac100million (\u00a390million) earlier this month. On that occasion, Barca bid a guaranteed \u20ac85million (\u00a378million) with a further \u20ac15million in add-ons.\n\nMeanwhile, a source at Barcelona has told the Catalan newspaper Mundo Deportivo that the La Liga side will \"fight to the end\" to sign Coutinho. The Brazilian is reported to have told Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp that he has no intention of playing for the club again even if it jeopardises his place in Brazil's World Cup squad for next summer.\n\nIt remains to be seen how all this pans out. Barcelona are expected to come back with a fourth bid despite Friday's rebuttal - one with a better set of terms than those that were offered in this latest bid.\n\nCoutinho is desperate to make the move to the Nou Camp even though he will only match the \u00a3200,000 a week he currently earns at Anfield by achieving a good number of add-ons and bonuses. After Barca's performances against Real Madrid in the Spanish Super Cup this week that looks unlikely. 10 times what they paid Rennes in 2016.\n\nHis suspension meant Dembele missed Saturday's 4-0 win at minnows Rielasingen-Arlen in the first round of the German Cup when Gabon hot-shot Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored a hat-trick.\n\nNow Dortmund's tough-tackling defender Sokratis Papastathopoulos says Dembele should follow the example of Aubameyang, who has been linked to a big-money move to China but has been told that he is staying.\n\n\"Ousmane is a good lad, but he has to recognise that no player is bigger than the team,\" Sokratis told Thursday's edition of magazine Kicker.\n\n\"Everyone has to be clear that he must work for the team and fall in line. This also applies to Ousmane - he can't just do whatever he wants.\n\n\"He should take Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang as an example. 'Auba' also could imagine leaving, but he behaves professionally in every training session and every game and gives his best.\n\n\"In the first round of the Cup, he scored three goals - Ousmane wasn't there.\n\n\"Ousmane has done no good by going on strike. He should not forget that he still has a long-term contract at Dortmund.\"\n\nSokratis says he hopes Dembele will return to training soon.\n\nHe remains suspended as Dortmund prepare for their opening game of the new Bundesliga season at Wolfsburg on Saturday.\n\n\"At first he has to get in touch with us again and come to training. Then we will see,\" said Sokratis.\n\n\"Ousmane has given a lot for us. He is a player who makes the difference and we need players like that.\n\n\"But we also need players who don't shut themselves out and who want to be part of our family. "body": "Borussia Dortmund's Ousmane Dembele arrives for the official team photo shoot in Dortmund August 9, 2017. -- Reuters picBERLIN, Aug 17 -- Want-away France winger Ousmane Dembele has been told to behave more professionally by one of his Borussia Dortmund team-mates in the ongoing saga surrounding a potential move to Barcelona.\n\nDembele, 20, has a contract until 2021 and was suspended by Dortmund last week for skipping training in a personal protest to attempt to force the German club to sell him to Barcelona.\n\nThe Spanish giants are looking for attacking reinforcements after losing Neymar to Paris Saint-Germain.\n\nPep Segura, Barcelona's general manager, has said they are \"close\" to completing a deal for Dembele as well as Liverpool's Philippe Coutinho, but Dortmund's CEO Hans-Joachim Watzke denied the claim today.\n\nAccording to Spanish media, Barcelona are offering \u20ac80 million (RM401.6 million), plus a bonus of \u20ac40 million, but Dortmund want \u20ac150 million for Dembele -- 10 times what they paid Rennes in 2016.\n\nHis suspension meant Dembele missed Saturday's 4-0 win at minnows Rielasingen-Arlen in the first round of the German Cup when Gabon hot-shot Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored a hat-trick.\n\nNow Dortmund's tough-tackling defender Sokratis Papastathopoulos says Dembele should follow the example of Aubameyang, who has been linked to a big-money move to China but has been told that he is staying.\n\n\"Ousmane is a good lad, but he has to recognise that no player is bigger than the team,\" Sokratis told today's edition of magazine Kicker.\n\n\"Everyone has to be clear that he must work for the team and fall in line. This also applies to Ousmane -- he can't just do whatever he wants.\n\n\"He should take Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang as an example. 'Auba' also could imagine leaving, but he behaves professionally in every training session and every game and gives his best.\n\n\"In the first round of the Cup, he scored three goals -- Ousmane wasn't there.\n\n\"Ousmane has done no good by going on strike. He should not forget that he still has a long-term contract at Dortmund.\"\n\nSokratis says he hopes Dembele will return to training soon.\n\nHe remains suspended as Dortmund prepare for their opening game of the new Bundesliga season at Wolfsburg on Saturday.\n\n\"At first he has to get in touch with us again and come to training. Then we will see,\" said Sokratis.\n\n\"Ousmane has given a lot for us. He is a player who makes the difference and we need players like that.\n\n\"But we also need players who don't shut themselves out and who want to be part of our family. Apparently Ousmane doesn't want that.\" -- AFP", "dateTime": "2017-08-17T13:05:00Z", "extractedDates": [{"textEnd": 104, "textStart": 90, "date": "2017-08-09", "amb": false}, {"textEnd": 134, 10 times what they paid Rennes in 2016.\n\nHis suspension meant Dembele missed Saturday's 4-0 win at minnows Rielasingen-Arlen in the first round of the German Cup when Gabon hot-shot Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored a hat-trick.\n\nNow Dortmund's tough-tackling defender Sokratis Papastathopoulos says Dembele should follow the example of Aubameyang, who has been linked to a big-money move to China but has been told that he is staying.\n\n\"Ousmane is a good lad, but he has to recognise that no player is bigger than the team,\" Sokratis told Thursday's edition of magazine Kicker.\n\n\"Everyone has to be clear that he must work for the team and fall in line. He should not forget that he still has a long-term contract at Dortmund.\"\n\nSokratis says he hopes Dembele will return to training soon.\n\nHe remains suspended as Dortmund prepare for their opening game of the new Bundesliga season at Wolfsburg on Saturday.\n\n\"At first he has to get in touch with us again and come to training.
